reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I find it strange what some other reviewers expect from a hotel. The last one re. Grand City said that 'it looked like an old 70's Iron Curtain concrete apartment block'. I would suggest that the reason it looks like that is because that's what it is. For the price asked, there is nothing wrong with this hotel: the rooms (rooms, notice) are large; well-equipped (what are you expecting furniture wise?) and immaculately clean. The shower is powerful and the hot water instant (and I do mean instant!). The staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The area is a bit run down but that goes for a lot of Leipzig. There are restaurants and bars nearby if you look for them (the one under the Handwerkskammer, Dresdner Str. 11/13 is particularly interesting) and the tram goes from almost outside. I don't want to live in a hotel room; it's somewhere I can put my head down or maybe drink a glass of wine and watch some footie on the perfectly adequate TV. I've paid a lot more for a lot worse in Leipzig (and other places). I'll be going back and hopefully I can get in through the main entrance rather than through the car park this time!
reviews.title: Good Hotel once you get inside!

reviews.title: A taste of the Eastern Block

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is set a 20 min walk from the Ald Stadt, and is surrounded by other old concrete blocks that are still lived in as apartments. The neighbors appear to be Romanians etc, who sit out late. The hotel rooms are very spartan and very basic. Furniture is substandard flat pack MDF stuff. I thought I was the worlds worst at putting that stuff together, but whoever built mine was worse ! The breakfast room is tiny and not big enough, and the standard of the food is poor.
reviews.title: Recommend

likes.liked: — exceptionally clean and staff very friendly
likes.disliked: — location, a little out the way
